text: Hi Sophie, Sorry for the delayed response. I have just wrapped on Detective Pikachu and been promoted to lead compositor :relaxed: so things have become very busy very quickly! Great to hear that you have been working on a short film, that kind of experience will definitely help with applying for future positions. Any experiences like that look good on a CV. I would be more than happy to look at any material that you are thinking about including in a reel. I don't really have any additional advice for applying for work / internships without seeing a reel. Having a good, succinct cover letter, cv and a short reel of your best (most relevant to the position) work should be sufficient in my opinion. Something that might be worth investigating would be <https://www.framestore.com/work/launchpad-pro> I don't really know a whole lot about it tbh but it's an initiative that framestore have undertaken to help get students their first step on the VFX career ladder I believe. I would assume that other companies run similar things, but from what I have heard internships tend to be oversubscribed and very competitive.

attachments.title: Launchpad Pro
attachments.text: Training students in the specific skills and knowledge expected within a junior role, this hands-on program acts as an accelerator for artists who want to kick start their careers in VFX.
